title: How to Print Recipes from Facebook

steps.headline: Go to the AddThis website.
steps.description: On a Chrome or Firefox browser, open this following link: http://www.addthis.com/browser-extensions#.UU3NwxyTiSo. One way to print recipes is to install an easy-to-use online program using a browser extension for Firefox or Chrome such as AddThis.

steps.headline: Download the program.
steps.description: On the main page, you will see the blue “Download for Free” button. Click on it.

steps.headline: Follow the instructions.
steps.description: After clicking on the Download tab, you just need to follow the instructions for the installation process. These instructions can be seen in the box when you start the installation process. When installation is complete, you should be able to see the button with the red plus sign on it. It should appear in the upper-right corner of your screen.

steps.headline: Click and print.
steps.description: When you find the recipe you’d like to print, click the red plus sign on your browser, and then select “Print” from the drop-down menu. When you click on this red button, you will be able to print any content from Facebook that you like—recipes and more.

methods.name: Printing Recipes Using Your Browser's Print Option

steps.headline: Log into your Facebook account.
steps.description: If you’re someone who’s not really into collecting content, but just on occasion find something you like, this method is the easier of the two methods as it involves just using the print option from your browser’s File menu.

steps.headline: Find the recipe post you would like to print.
steps.description: Once you do, simply stay where you are.

steps.headline: Find the File and the Print options.
steps.description: The File option is located on the top of your browser screen. From its drop-down menu options, click on “Print.”

steps.headline: Find the page that contains your recipe on the Print Preview.
steps.description: Select that page to be the page to be printed out.

steps.headline: Click on the “Print” button that appears in the window.
steps.description: The page that is printed out will be the one you chose. If the recipe happens to be an image, click on it to open the image, and then just follow the instructions for printing.

text: Printing Recipes Using AddThis Go to the AddThis website. On a Chrome or Firefox browser, open this following link: http://www.addthis.com/browser-extensions#.UU3NwxyTiSo. One way to print recipes is to install an easy-to-use online program using a browser extension for Firefox or Chrome such as AddThis. Download the program. On the main page, you will see the blue “Download for Free” button. Click on it. Follow the instructions. After clicking on the Download tab, you just need to follow the instructions for the installation process. These instructions can be seen in the box when you start the installation process. When installation is complete, you should be able to see the button with the red plus sign on it. It should appear in the upper-right corner of your screen. Click and print. When you find the recipe you’d like to print, click the red plus sign on your browser, and then select “Print” from the drop-down menu. When you click on this red button, you will be able to print any content from Facebook that you like—recipes and more. Printing Recipes Using Your Browser's Print Option Log into your Facebook account. If you’re someone who’s not really into collecting content, but just on occasion find something you like, this method is the easier of the two methods as it involves just using the print option from your browser’s File menu. Find the recipe post you would like to print. Once you do, simply stay where you are. Find the File and the Print options. The File option is located on the top of your browser screen. From its drop-down menu options, click on “Print.” Find the page that contains your recipe on the Print Preview. Select that page to be the page to be printed out. Click on the “Print” button that appears in the window. The page that is printed out will be the one you chose. If the recipe happens to be an image, click on it to open the image, and then just follow the instructions for printing.
